xwiki-bridge - (09:38): [vmassol] !news  
xwiki-bridge - (09:41): [vmassol] !search test  
xwiki-bridge - (09:42): [vmassol] blah blah !news blah blah  
xwiki-bridge - (09:44): [vmassol] !jira Model  
xwiki-bridge - (09:44): [vmassol] ok all botlets are now working  
xwiki-bridge - (09:46): [CalebJamesDeLisle] So what happens if someone creates a document with ! news in the name?  
xwiki-bridge - (09:47): [vmassol] you'll get the 2 events  
xwiki-bridge - (09:48): [vmassol] :)  
xwiki-bridge - (09:54): [vmassol] I love this comment in PropertyMetaClass:  
xwiki-bridge - (09:54): [vmassol]         // This should not be touched  
xwiki-bridge - (09:54): [vmassol]         // safeput("classType", type\_class);  
xwiki-bridge - (09:55): [vmassol] and we can't even blame him publicly since he's no longer a committer! (apparently it was Luis Arias who did it ;))  
xwiki-bridge - (09:57): [CalebJamesDeLisle] That's what I was talking about yesterday, separating objects which are mapped to the same table.

xwiki-bridge - (10:01): [vmassol] since get/setName() is used for 2 purposes:  
xwiki-bridge - (10:02): [vmassol] - storing document reference  
xwiki-bridge - (10:04): [vmassol] - storing the class type value in a "name" property  
xwiki-bridge - (10:04): [vmassol] hmm maybe not  
xwiki-bridge - (10:04): [vmassol] thinking some more

xwiki-bridge - (11:30): [vmassol] jerome.velociter: 2 questions  
xwiki-bridge - (11:31): [vmassol] on http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/LiveTable why is it still a draft?  
xwiki-bridge - (11:31): [vmassol] (and why did you remove the 1.9 warning? it wasn't correct? This is for my knowledge)  
Enygma`1 left at 11:36 ("Leaving."  
Enygma` joined #xwiki at 11:36  
xwiki-bridge - (11:49): [glerouge] I'm trying to do this in Lucene Search: #set($extraClause = " AND Code.ArticleClass.application:${selectedApplication}")  
xwiki-bridge - (11:49): [glerouge] but it doesn't seem to work  
xwiki-bridge - (11:49): [glerouge] ${selectedApplication} is from a DBList property  
xwiki-bridge - (11:50): [glerouge] it used to work when it was a static list  
xwiki-bridge - (11:51): [tmortagne] glerouge: what is the class of $selectedApplication ? $selectedApplication.class  
xwiki-bridge - (11:52): [glerouge] it s from the Code.ArticleClass class  
xwiki-bridge - (11:55): [glerouge] any reason why a dblist would be treated differently than a staticlist by lucene ?  
xwiki-bridge - (12:00): [glerouge] do I need to add anything more to the lucene query ?  
xwiki-bridge - (12:05): [lucaa] glerouge: I can look at the code and see if the 2 props are handled differently by lucene  
xwiki-bridge - (12:05): [glerouge] I was hoping tmortagne knew the answer, that would be cool, thanks  
xwiki-bridge - (12:07): [tmortagne] glerouge: I don't know this kind of detail yet sorry, i would have to look at the code  
xwiki-bridge - (12:07): [glerouge] ok  
xwiki-bridge - (12:08): [glerouge] I have to leave for about 2 hours, I'll be back afterwards  
xwiki-bridge - (12:10): [tmortagne] glerouge: maybe your problem is simply that Lucene doe snot execute your DBLIst query  
Enygma`1 joined #xwiki at 12:10  
Enygma` left at 12:10 (Connection reset by peer  
xwiki-bridge - (12:11): [vmassol] CalebJamesDeLisle: ok I have to rollback my change.... too bad; The reason is that BaseProperty instances (they are XClass property definitions) use BaseElement and use the name to store a property definition name (which are NOT references)  
xwiki-bridge - (12:11): [tmortagne] since Lucene is has a static index it can't support dynamic generated list like DBLists  
xwiki-bridge - (12:11): [vmassol] so basically BaseElement is used for 2 different things: references and property definition names  
kibahop left #xwiki at 12:11  
xwiki-bridge - (12:12): [CalebJamesDeLisle] You are brave to even touch those strings.  
xwiki-bridge - (12:12): [glerouge] actually ludo found my issue  
xwiki-bridge - (12:12): [glerouge] I was searching for the prop instead of the document name  
xwiki-bridge - (12:12): [glerouge] sorry for the disturbance, thks for the help  
kibaho1 joined #xwiki at 12:13  
xwiki-bridge - (12:13): [tmortagne] glerouge: in aby case i don't see how DBList can be fully supported by Lucene, you can only use it for selected element in a list but not for the dynamic list of elements  
xwiki-bridge - (13:26): [vmassol] this is really crap......  
xwiki-bridge - (13:26): [vmassol] in BaseElement even though the name can be anything there's still a getDocument() method that use getName as a reference ....

sunny\_slls - (13:46): excluding me, is there any indian out here ? :)

xwiki-bridge - (16:18): [CalebJamesDeLisle] I can't get jcaptcha2 to build, it looks like a library has changed and it doesn't want to build in jdk6.  
xwiki-bridge - (16:19): [CalebJamesDeLisle] Should I go ahead and commit the captcha component as is and wait for the 2.0 version?  
xwiki-bridge - (16:20): [sdumitriu] Why do you want to buld jcaptcha2?  
xwiki-bridge - (16:20): [vmassol] CalebJamesDeLisle: hmmm if you have it working with jcaptcha1 now I think you could go ahead indeed. You could ask on the list to see what others say  
xwiki-bridge - (16:20): [sdumitriu] Isn't it available in a maven repo?  
Enygma` joined #xwiki at 16:21  
xwiki-bridge - (16:21): [CalebJamesDeLisle] No it isn't in any repo :(  
xwiki-bridge - (16:21): [vmassol] CalebJamesDeLisle: re jcaptcha2 it's a question of not long. I'll call MAG  
xwiki-bridge - (16:21): [vmassol] doing it now  
xwiki-bridge - (16:21): [vmassol] MAG = Marc-Antoine Guarrigue (the author)  
Enygma` left at 16:21 (Read error: 104 (Connection reset by peer)  
xwiki-bridge - (16:22): [CalebJamesDeLisle] Thanks, also would you advise putting this up for a vote? It's a new component but doesn't change any existing things except adding a velocity binding.  
Enygma` joined #xwiki at 16:24  
Enygma` left at 16:24 (Read error: 54 (Connection reset by peer)  
xwiki-bridge - (16:24): [tmortagne] CalebJamesDeLisle: if there is a jcaptcha2 jar provided at least you can put in in XWiki external repository without rebuilding it  
xwiki-bridge - (16:25): [lucaa] vmassol: tmortagne I just read the mail. but it's basically the same thing  
xwiki-bridge - (16:25): [tmortagne] that's the case of most of the jar we have in this repository  
xwiki-bridge - (16:25): [CalebJamesDeLisle] Couldn't find one of those either.  
xwiki-bridge - (16:25): [lucaa] we did talk about the advantage of classname[objindex] as a string, because it could be a name in the future  
xwiki-bridge - (16:25): [tmortagne] CalebJamesDeLisle: ok  
xwiki-bridge - (16:25): [lucaa] and the vote between a and b was about this  
xwiki-bridge - (16:26): [lucaa] also, if we will want names, and now we implement a) then we can make it non-indexed at any point and leave it as an object name (unique)  
xwiki-bridge - (16:26): [lucaa] I mean, a) should be extensible too, shouldn't it?  
xwiki-bridge - (16:26): [tmortagne] CalebJamesDeLisle: are you sure there as been release of JCAPTCHA ?  
xwiki-bridge - (16:27): [tmortagne] the javadoc is speaking about alpha-1  
xwiki-bridge - (16:27): [tmortagne] http://jcaptcha.sourceforge.net/apidocs/2.0-alpha1/  
xwiki-bridge - (16:27): [tmortagne] JCAPTCHA=JCAPTCHA2  
xwiki-bridge - (16:27): [CalebJamesDeLisle] No it's alpha but supposedly production ready.  
xwiki-bridge - (16:27): [tmortagne] ok  
xwiki-bridge - (16:27): [tmortagne] I guess that's why you can't find jar released

xwiki-bridge - (16:38): [vmassol] the link is on the wiki home page btw (for jcaptcha2)
